content:
I study the genes of the deadless pathogens in the world: SARS-CoV-2 and Mycobacterium tuberculosis. I am interested in the understanding of these pathogens with a bioinformatics aproach, with a focus on open-source methods.
  Download my resumé.
summary: I study the genes of the deadless pathogens in the world: SARS-CoV-2 and Mycobacterium tuberculosis. I am interested in the understanding of these pathogens with a bioinformatics aproach, with a focus on open-source methods.
title: Paula Ruiz-Rodriguez

content: Click the Cite button above to get .bib reference to import into your reference management software
summary: We have detected two mutations in the spike protein of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) at amino acid positions 1163 and 1167 that appeared independently in multiple transmission clusters and different genetic backgrounds.They generate a whole new cluster inside 20E.
title: Evolutionary and Phenotypic Characterization of Two Spike Mutations in European Lineage 20E of SARS-CoV-2

content: Click the Cite button above to get .bib reference to import into your reference management software
summary: We have analyzed the genetic diversity of the SARS-CoV-2 population in an immunocompromised patient with long covid.
title: Persistent SARS-CoV-2 infection with repeated clinical recurrence in a patient with common variable immunodeficiency

content: Click the Cite button above to get .bib reference to import into your reference management software.
summary: We have analyzed the genetic diversity of the SARS-CoV-2 in the First wave of the COVID-19 epidemic in Spain.
title: The first wave of the COVID-19 epidemic in Spain was associated with early introductions and fast spread of a dominating genetic variant

content: Click the Cite button above to get .bib reference to import into your reference management software
summary: We described a new Lineage of SARS-CoV-2, 20E lineage.
title: Spread of a SARS-CoV-2 variant through Europe in the summer of 2020

content: Click the Cite button above to get .bib reference to import into your reference management software
summary: We described a new Lineage of *Mycobacterium tuberculosis*, closely related to L6.
title: Phylogenomics of Mycobacterium africanum reveals a new lineage and a complex evolutionary history
